db:abstract.db:para: Demonstrates anchor layout on a graphics view scene.

db:article.db:para: The Simple Anchor Layout example shows the basic use of the QGraphicsAnchorLayout class.
The example starts by creating a QGraphicsScene (scene), 3 widgets (a, b, and c), and a QGraphicsAnchorlayout (layout).
First it anchors the top left corner of item a to the top left corner of layout. This can be done in two steps:
db:article.db:programlisting: layout->addAnchor(a, Qt::AnchorTop, layout, Qt::AnchorTop); layout->addAnchor(a, Qt::AnchorLeft, layout, Qt::AnchorLeft);
db:article.db:para: Then the right anchor of a is anchored to the left anchor of b, and the top of item b is anchored to the bottom of a.
db:article.db:programlisting: layout->addAnchor(b, Qt::AnchorLeft, a, Qt::AnchorRight); layout->addAnchor(b, Qt::AnchorTop, a, Qt::AnchorBottom);
